paper_abstract: The Eindhoven quantifier notation is systematic, unlike standard mathematicial notation. This has the major advantage that calculations with quantified expressions become more straightforward because the calculational rules need be given just once for a great variety of different quantifiers. We demonstrate the ease of calculation with finite quantifications by considering a number of examples. Two are simple warm-up exercises, using boolean equality as the quantifier. Three are taken from books of challenging mathematical problems, and one is a problem concocted by the authors to demonstrate the techniques.
